page.title: 06Scotton/Northorpe Employment
page.content: Few people in this farming area are employed in agriculture (see Farming) the majority of men work in towns, many in Scunthorpe where British Steel is the largest employer in the area. 8 or so men work in education; others work in industry, banking, insurance, accountancy, journalism and the law (police and solicitors); market trad- ers, lorry drivers, railway workers, electricans, builders and council workers. Some are self-employed (see Trade) and some are unemployed. In recent years several men have taken jobs abroad, their wives coping alone with home and family in their absence. An increasing number of women work, mainly in teaching shops and secre- tarial work. Glebe House employs 15 women: the proposed restaurant at Nor- thorpe should provide more jobs. There is seasonal, casual work on the farms.
